result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF76 and 22CF77 called at 9:45am [Court Reporter: Lisa Kwasigroch]
Defendant Darius L Ashford in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Darius L Ashford.  
Defendant Aaron Riles does not appear. Attorney Martin Russell Tanz appears via telephone for Aaron Riles. 
Attorney Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

As to Case 22CF76, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs: 
Mr. Ashford waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

The Court has learned off record that Atty Tanz intends on submitting motion. 
recess: 9:52am 

NEXT: As to Case 22CF76, Arraignment on 11/18/22 at 10:30am 
As to Case 22CF77, Status Conference on 11/18/22 at 10:30am
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF76 and #22CF77 called at 3:33pm 
Co-Defendant Darius L Ashford in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.
Co-Defendant Aaron J Riles in court with Attorney Martin Tanz.
ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

As to case #22CF76 Adjourned Initial Appearance is held:  
--preliminary hearing time limits are waived by both parties 
--Attorney Huebner requests the scheduling of a pretrial conference 
recess 3:40pm.  

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference in Case #22CF76 only on August 10th at 10:00am-only counsel need to appear,  (2) Preliminary Hearing in Case #22CF76 on September 2nd at 9:30am, (3) Status Conference on  September 2nd at 9:30am in Case #22CF77--Attorney Tanz may appear by telephone, and Co-Defendant Aaron Riles does not need to appear
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Ok to remove hearing. will be re-set by the court in 60 days.
Defense letter request to reschedule 6/7 hearing.

Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Cases 22CF76 & 22CF77 called at 11:33am 
Defendant Aaron J Riles in court with Attorney Tanz 
Defendant Darius Ashford appears in court. 
ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 22CF76: Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Ashford indicates that he intends to hire private counsel, met with one yesterday.

As to Case 22CF77:
Mr. Riles waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 11:42am 

NEXT:  As to Case 22CF77(Riles) (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/13/22 at 10:00am    (2) Status Conference on 6/7/22 at 2:30pm 
As to Case 22CF76(Ashford): Status Conference on 6/7/22 at 2:30pm
Adjourned initial appearance on March 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:24 PM 
Defendant Aaron J Riles in court.   Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr. Riles indicates that he has obtained counsel; counsel was unable to appear today.

The Court adjourns for status of counsel.

recess: 1:26pm
NEXT:Adjourned Initial Appearance(status on counsel) on 3/18/22 at 9:00am (co-def scheduled for 11am)
Adjourned initial appearance on February 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ma] Case called at 1:45 PM 
Defendant Aaron J Riles appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only--declined to be evaluated).  ADA Jeffrey De La Rosa appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to Counsel reviewed
The Court tolls preliminary hearing time limites

The Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with co-defendant, Darius Ashford
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 1:52  pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 2/25/22 at 1:15pm (status of counsel?)
